metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7917 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The nfnetlink_rcv_batch function in net/netfilter/nfnetlink.c in the Linux kernel before 4.5 does not check whether a batch message's length field is large enough, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory or cause a denial of service (infinite loop or out-of-bounds read) by leveraging the CAP_NET_ADMIN capability. It was discovered that the netfilter netlink implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate batch messages. A local attacker with the CAP_NET_ADMIN capability could use this to expose sensitive information or cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7917` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-79-generic - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-lowlatency - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-79-generic - 4.4.0-79.100
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> requires CAP_NET_ADMIN to exploit

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-79.100').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1018.27').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
